sections.PURPOSE: of this LFX block is to certify crews, squads, and platoons for UCRF and LFX progression in preparation for the EDRE to Poland. This is critical because it enables future training as well as ensures that our platoons are lethal combat formations.

Conduct field maintenance throughout the operation IOT come out of training with the highest readiness possible.

sections.SUSTAINMENT:
CL I (R): Ration cycle is A-M-A. Each Troop supply will pick up mermites (AMA) from DFAC. Troop supply is responsible for plasticware/cups CL III (P): Fueler will rotate to each range between dry period (0500-0800). Emergency resupply at night down time (1800-2100). Troops will have all fuel cans on hand topped off for emergency resupply. CL V: Ammunition will be dropped off upon occupation by Lightning Troop. Lightning Troop is responsible for coordinating drop off with Fury Troop. If drop off the day prior to beginning training is not feasible, Fury will drop off 0500-0600.
Maintenance: Fury will maintain one contact truck at VAAF (14-15MAR) each gunnery range (15-20MAR) and at Lightning’s PLT LFX (21-22MAR.) A wrecker will be on standby at Rose Barracks 14-16MAR and 21-23MAR. From 17-20MAR, the wrecker will be located at Range 112.
Maintenance priorities can be found on the SQDN Synchmat.
